review.title: Deceptive pricing in a low-end version of luxury
review.reviewText:
When you get to the hotel, the first thing you see is a bar, a literal red-and-white striped physical barrier that prevents you from entering.  Next to it is a sign that says: $X/hour, $YY/day to even enter the lot.

The cost was higher before we even checked in.  That, to me, is RIDICULOUSLY deceptive.  It's located very close to the airport, with tightly controlled areas all about (razor wire) so it was about 4 blocks away when we found a parking spot, we timed it, an 11 minute walk away.  Took less time to drive to the airport than to get to our car from the hotel.

It was a mostly new facility.  Clean.  Nice colors and very refreshing design.  For the advertised price, it was an OK deal, and very conveniently located.  For the actual cost with parking, I would not have chosen it, it would be far above the acceptable price.

The staff was mostly clueless though: they didn't understand or even acknowledge or want to discuss there was a problem arriving to find out the rate was a full **ZZ% higher** than I'd agreed.  They said, "we allow a 15 minute grace period to check in, for free."  I did not see that on any sign when trying to enter, but that wasn't even the point.  You're trapped there and either pay the extra or park 4 blocks away.

I've replaced all reference to the actual costs, percentages and prices with XX YY and ZZ, (per Expedia policy preventing reviews with prices).  This is part of the problem!  Be transparent.

review.title: Nice modern hotel near airport
review.reviewText:
This hotel is very modern which was fun since we have always stayed at places that are decorated in a more "classic" style.  Our room was on the 6th floor so we had a great view of the city.  The bathroom and bedroom area looked almost brand new.  There is no bathtub, just a shower, but it is very large.  There are two shower heads--a fixed one that is installed higher up, and one that is installed a bit lower that is also detachable.  The shower has a fold down seat and bars for those with mobility issues.  The shower also has wall dispensers for body wash and a 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner.  Bliss is the brand name for the bath products.  The door to the bathroom is a sliding door instead of a regular door, and on the bathroom side of the door is a large full-length mirror.

We stayed in a room with a king-size bed and pillows that were very comfortable (we slept well).  The air conditioner in the room worked well and was quiet, and it is controlled by an actual thermostat on the wall which is nice.  There were plenty of outlets so we had no problems trying to find free outlets to charge our phones and camera batteries.  The curtains in the room are controlled electronically which was pretty cool.  The room also had a small refrigerator, but it was located in the bathroom which was kinda weird.  No big deal though.  There is a hotel shuttle that runs to and from the airport every half hour which is very convenient, and there was a laundry room on our floor.

Wi-Fi connected everywhere without difficulty.

The hotel lobby, elevators and hallway have trendy, bolder, colorful decor combined with dim lighting. Some design elements such as the gel floor inset in the elevator looked dirty instead of trendy as a product of poor lighting. The king-sized room I stayed in was functional, clean and quite beautiful for the star rating.

My floor was mostly quiet on a busy weekend in the city however on two occasions, there was noise that disturbed my stay such as the neighbor's personal phone and alarm. review.title: Design & Comfort...BOOK THIS HOTEL!
review.reviewText: My husband and I booked Aloft based upon the great reviews it had received. This hotel deserves all of it's positive reviews. The best feature was our room. It was super mod and comfy with attention to design and detail: excellent bedding, beautiful bathroom, clean. The in-room reading went perfectly with the feeling of the room: Wired & Dwell. The lobby and grounds were equally tricked out. The downside is parking. We had a late check in on Friday night so the parking lot was already packed. It is a long haul to get to your room.This is a big hotel with a tiny front desk staff. The staff was okay: not overly friendly or helpful. Several times we waited in a line to ask questions of the 2-3 people working the desk. Eventually we gave up. BUT we will definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.
